lines.text: Mr. Harden, it's my duty to inform you that the larceny of an equine is a capital offense punishable by death, but you can rest assured that in this court, a horse thief always gets a fair trial before he's hung.

[to Bean]
When I was a kid, I had a pet rattlesnake. I was fond of it, but I wouldn't turn my back on it.
Don't spill none of that liquor, son. It eats right into the bar.
shooting a steer. Do you got anything to say for yourself before the sentence of the court is executed?
I told you they shot at me first. I didn't mean to kill that steer on purpose. I was aiming at the man.
It's your bad luck you missed him. That's the trouble with you sodbusters... you can't shoot straight. Shad, may the Lord have mercy on your soul.
Have you met Miss Langtry?
No, I never met her. I never met the sun, I never shook hands with the moon, and I've never been introduced to no clouds.
You live in a house, don't you?
No. No, my house is all out there. One room, with a sky for a roof.
I haven't worn this uniform since Chickamaugie, but it still fits right smart.
Are you an attorney, Miss?
I'm as much an attorney as you are a judge!
We're goin' back to build our fences.
If you do, you better build coffins with them. Now git!
You get warrants in Fort Davis, don't you?
Yes, that's where they get 'em, but they don't know how to spell my name. It's been tried before.
I'll get one. This time you'll get what's comin' to you, Judge.
[repeated line]
By gobs!
Don't make a move, Judge. I'm comin down to get ya.
Come a-shootin.
